long: Meaning: properly, to "bore", i.e. (by implication) to "wound", to "dissolve"; figuratively, to "profane" (a person, place or thing), to "break" (one's word), to "begin" (as if by an 'opening wedge'); to "play" (the flute).  Usage: begin (× men began), defile, × break, defile, × eat (as common things), × first, × gather the grape thereof, × take inheritance, pipe, player on instruments, pollute, (cast as) profane (self), prostitute, slay (slain), sorrow, stain, wound.  Source: a primitive root (compare "H2470"); also denominative (from "H2485")
